actions.text: Reported to House from the Committee on Appropriations, H. Rept. 94-1220.
Measure called up by special rule in House.
Measure considered in House.
Motion to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations with instructions rejected in House, roll call #434 (98-294).
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #435 (369-18).
Referred to Senate Committee on Appropriations.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Appropriations with amendment, S. Rept. 94-974.

Measure considered in Senate.
Measure passed Senate, amended, roll call #349 (53-2).
Conference scheduled in Senate.

Senate agreed to conference report.

Measure enrolled in Senate.

Public law 94-378.

official_title: An Act making appropriations for the Department of Housing and Urban Development, and for sundry independent executive agencies, boards, bureaus, commissions, corporations, and offices for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1977, and for other purposes.
short_title: Department of Housing and Urban Development-Independent Agencies Appropriation Act
subjects: Department of Housing and Urban Development

summary.text: (Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 94-1362) Department of Housing and Urban Development - Independent Agencies Appropriation Act - =Title I: Department of Housing and Urban Development= - Appropriates specified sums for fiscal year 1977 to the Department of Housing and Urban Development for: (1) housing programs; (2) the Government National Mortgage Association; (3) community planning and development; (4) the Federal Insurance Administration; (5) management and administration; and (6) the Federal Disaster Assistance Administration. =Title II: Independent Agencies= - Appropriates for fiscal year 1977 specified sums for: (1) the American Battle Monuments Commission; (2) the Consumer Product Safety Commission; (3) the Department of Defense, Army civil cemeterial expenses; (4) the Environmental Protection Agency (prohibiting use of any budget authority through September 30, 1976, for any grant for areawide waste treatment management planning in excess of 75 percent of the cost); (5) the Executive Office of the President; (6) the General Services Administration; (7) the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare; (8) the National Aeronautics and Space Administration; (9) the National Science Foundation; (10) the Selective Service System; (11) the Department of the Treasury; and (12) the Veterans' Administration. =Title III: Corporations= - Appropriates to the Federal Home Loan Bank Board specified sums for fiscal year 1977. =Title IV: General Provisions= - Sets forth general and administrative restrictions upon the expenditure of funds appropriated by this Act.
